^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Method.description: Specify either CRAM-MD5 or LOGIN as the authentication method. Default authentication method is CRAM-MD5.
Method.longDescription: CRAM-MD5 is a challenge-response authentication mechanism based on the HMAC-MD5 MAC algorithm.

Password.description: This property is used with a PATCH or PUT to write the password for the account. This property is null on a GET.
Password.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the password when authentication required. The value shall be null for GET requests.

Required.description: Indicates if the authentication is required or not.
Required.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a boolean indicating whether this authentication mechanism is required.

UserName.description: This property contains the user name for the account.
UserName.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the user name for this account.

LenovoSMTPClient.description: This is the schema definition for the LenovoSMTPClient resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AccessInfo.description: Indicates the IP address of the SMTP server expressed in dotted decimal notation or Host Name in a text string.
AccessInfo.longDescription: Use this field to specify either the IP address or, if DNS is enabled and configured, the hostname of the SMTP server.

AccessPort.description: Indicates then port number of the SMTP server.
AccessPort.longDescription: The port number for SMTP server is optional. If left blank, the default value is 25.

Authentication.description: This used for SMTP client indicates an authentication mechanism to the server.
Authentication.longDescription: Users can configure the authentication mechanism for SMTP client.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

ProtocolEnabled.description: Indicates if the protocol is enabled or disabled.
ProtocolEnabled.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol. The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

ReversePath.description: Specify where the mail is from to the SMTP server.
ReversePath.longDescription: Users can modify the setting, the value shall be matched with checking rules.

title: #LenovoSMTPClient.v1_0_0.LenovoSMTPClient
